comments.author: Eileen
comments.content: This salad sounds super easy & super delicious! Grated carrots are such an underrated salad veg--I love them so. :)

comments.author: Moira
comments.content:
Thanks for the link to Ellen Kanner's book.  All in the metaphysics of food.

I've been shredding carrots with other veggies in an herbed water-lemon infusion for quick wrap sandwiches for decades.  The carrots are so pretty, my kids never stopped once to think "Mom's trying to feed us vegetables".

:-)

comments.author: Irina @ wandercrush
comments.content: Nice! Carrots were the only food I hated when I was a kid, but thankfully they've been growing on me in the last couple of years. Fortunately I can make recipes like this now ;) I've been craving Moroccan flavours lately.

comments.author: Foods4Health
comments.content:
Such good timing to have recently found your blog. I was just looking for a new carrot recipe (after a couple of days of eating plain, raw carrots). This recipe looks great and is 
simple enough to follow, which is always a plus.

Thanks for all that you do and am excited to find other great recipes on your site. All the best :).

comments.author: Sofia
comments.content: What a great and simple recipe! looks like we will be making this today.

comments.author: islandami
comments.content: Truly sorry your book didn't win.

comments.author: Asha
comments.content: As simple as it looks, I'm sure it is yummy.  So similar to one of our indian versions, but I'm gonna try your recipe next...

comments.author: Candice
comments.content: This looks like tit would take forever to make! I love easy dishes that are so impressive everyone thinks I was in the kitchen all day!

comments.author: Chitra
comments.content:
The colors of this salad are superb! My sister-in-law and brother are enjoying your book very much, am so happy I got them a copy of it. Happy you enjoyed your trip out to NY.  Have you been to Kalustyan's? I think you would love it if you haven't already made a visit there.

Best,
Chitra

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks, Chitra! Yes, Kalustyan's is quite wonderful. I'm a sucker for any market that has that kind of range of supplies.

comments.author: Roxy
comments.content: What a simple, easy, and delicous-looking recipe. Thank you so much for the idea! You have a great blog, will be stopping-by more often.

comments.author: Ilan Cohen @ NYC LASIK
comments.content: You wrote such nice things about this meal that you convinced me. Even though, I don't really like carrots. But I'm giving it a try, let's see.

comments.author: John
comments.content: Nice! We really liked this, but even with one lemon it was a bit more sour than I'd like. I might increase the cumin to 1.5t, and use less honey and lemon.  One other thing: when I poured the oil over the carrots, some remained behind. So I grabbed some carrots and stirred them around in the oily pan to get the last of it. I used the aleppo pepper -- perhaps 1/2t -- and it was great.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Good tip, using the carrots to get the rest of the seasoned oil!

comments.author: kayla
comments.content: This recipe is a delicious, and fresh side I made for my family alongside, corn on the cobb and burgers(veggie for me). I got excited and didn't read through the instructions so I just added the spices and oil without simmering first but it still tastes wonderful and refreshing. I also added fresh parsley from my garden so I was excited about that. This would also be good as an addition to spinach or romaine salad.

comments.author: Mary @ Fit and Fed
comments.content: Congratulations on the nomination for the James Beard award, what an honor! And I'm glad you got the swell trip out of it. I'd love to try this salad with the fried cumin, paprika, and cayenne. I make an Indian-style carrot salad that's kind of a simple cousin of this one. You fry black mustard seeds in vegetable oil for a few seconds and then pour it over the carrots.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks, Mary! I'm crazy about black mustard seeds too.

comments.author: Chezzie
comments.content: Thanks Michael, I am seriously into cumin at the moment since my Moroccan neighbour gave me Fava beans in cumin and olive oil as a snack, delicious!  I love carrots so this is on my menu for this evening!

comments.author: Shelley @ Two Healthy Kitchens
comments.content: First off, a belated congrats on the very-much-deserved Beard nomination! And secondly, a tremendous thank-you for the tip on another excellent cookbook! My mom and dad own a little private bookstore, so I have far more cookbooks than I should (just ask my husband!), but you can bet that I am now on the lookout for "Feeding the Hungry Ghost"! Most of my recipes fall into the category of super-quick yet flavorful, healthy and family-friendly. This recipe is a winner on all fronts - can't wait to try it!

comments.author: Andrea Cole
comments.content: This looks super easy and delicious, while I like eating well the kitchen sadly is not my happy place.  I look for recipes like this that I can't mess up too badly.  Congrats on the nomination.

comments.author: Charlie
comments.content: mmmm delicious!
